metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17480 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
Execution of user supplied Javascript during array deserialization leading to an out of bounds write in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
